briefly.title: Briefly about me
briefly.text: I started being interested in programming back in the 8th grade and for a long time could not decide what exactly do I wanted to do , so at a good basic level I know several programming languages, including: C#, Python and JS. In the end, I chose Front-end development and studied HTML, CSS and JavaScript quite deeply.

education.title: My education
education.text:
At the moment, I am studying in Heigher School of Economics for Software engineering, graduation year - 2025
I am studying for free, thanks to 288 points for the RNE:
Math - 99
Computer Science - 96
Russian - 93

layout.title: Layout
layout.text: I feel very confident in HTML and CSS. I can make up using flex and grid. As a preprocessor, I usually use SASS in the SCSS syntax. I also understand what the BEM methodology is

javaScript.title: JavaScript
javaScript.text: I understand how the JS engine works, what micro- and macro-tasks are, how asynchrony and promises work, and much, much more

typeScript.title: TypeScript
typeScript.text: Although it is faster to code in standard JS, strict typing allows you to notice many errors even at the stage of writing code. That's why I use TypeScript very often

react.title: React
react.text: I write using functional components and hooks. I can use libraries such as Redux, Axios, react router dom, react transition group and others

nodeJS.title: NodeJS
nodeJS.text: In my pet projects, I write back-end using Node. Also, of course, I know how to use npm and yarn package managers

git.title: Git
git.text: I know how to use GitHub and the Git version control system both in the console and inside my IDE

oop.title: OOP & FP
oop.text: I understand the essence and principles of object-oriented and functional programming, I easily read and write code in both of these paradigms

algorithms.title: Algorithms
algorithms.text: Thanks to participating in many Olympiads and solving problems on the acmp and codesignal websites, I learned to solve algorithmic problems well enough and calculate the effectiveness of algorithms

testing.title: Unit testing
testing.text: I have written a lot of unit tests in C#. I understand what it is and why it is needed. I also know how to analyze test code coverage

sql.title: SQL
sql.text: I understand how databases work and I know how to write queries to them. I have experience working with SQLite, MySQL, PostgreSQL

python.title: Python
python.text: Before I plunged into the web development, for a long time I wrote on python. Among other things, I have experience using the following libraries: tkinter, typing, sqlite3, webbrowser, selenium, bs4, requests, pandas

dotNet.title: .NET
dotNet.text: The main academic language at the Higher School of Economics is C#, so I just have to be able to handle it confidently

React.title: React
React.text: Front-end part of the site is based on the ReactJS library

Figma.title: Figma
Figma.text: I made the design of the site myself, you can see the layout at the <href>link</href>

SASS.title: SASS
SASS.text: All styles are written by using a preprocessor in SCSS syntax

SVG.title: SVG
SVG.text: The site uses a minimum of raster graphics and there are absolutely no .png images on it

Git.title: Git & Github
Git.text: During development I used Git as VCS, you can find the source code on <href>my GitHub</href>

NodeJS.title: NodeJS
NodeJS.text: The Back-end part of the site is small, so NodeJS is an ideal option for writing it on

TypeScript.title: TypeScript
TypeScript.text:
Why not dynamically typed default JavaScript?
Because I can.

works.title: Other works
works.gitHub: Search for more of my projects on GitHub
